page.title: 13STATUES IN ST.HELIER
page.content:
There are many statues and monuments in St.Helier. These commemorate historical events, the two world wars, royalty and famous people. A typical monument is the{Don {Memorial:}Lt.General Sir George Don, a Commander in the 59th Regiment stationed in Jersey, was the Lt.Governor of Jersey 1806-1814. The monument,built in 1885 by P.Robinet, is situated in the Parade Gardens, a local meeting place and shopping area. It consists of a group of 3 statues of cast iron on a Jersey granite platform. Don is flanked by the seated figures of Commerce and Industry. The statues,approached by steps,are flanked by old cannons. A plaque on Don's plinth reads:
{'A Don 1806-1814'}
